Key Match Events: Senegal secured their place in the knockout stages of AFCON 2023 after a thrilling 3-1 victory over Cameroon in their second group game.
Ismaila Sarr's deflected shot and Habib Diallo's sweeping finish put the reigning African champions in a comfortable position.
Jean-Charles Castelletto's goal for Cameroon with seven minutes of injury time remaining put the Teranga Lions under immense pressure.
Sadio Mane stepped up in the 95th minute to score his first goal of the tournament and seal the victory for Senegal.
Aguibou Camara's 69th-minute strike secured Guinea's 1-0 victory over Gambia.
Pre-Game Insights: The Stade Charles Konan Banny de Yamoussoukro will reverberate with anticipation as Guinea lock horns with Senegal in a decisive Group C clash at the Africa Cup of Nations.
The National Elephants need just one point to secure a top-two finish in the group and guarantee their qualification for the knockout stage.
The Teranga Lions, who have already sealed their place in the last 16, must avoid defeat to finish top of the group.
Senegal will look to maintain their unbeaten run in their final group game on Tuesday.
Avoiding defeat would guarantee Senegal first place and potentially a more favourable tie in the next round.
Senegal are now unbeaten in their last six matches, including friendlies, winning the last three, while they have also not lost in their last nine AFCON matches, dating back to the 2022 tournament.

Cisse, who suffered a gastric infection and spent the night under observation in hospital after the Cameroon game, will be hoping his side can deliver another strong performance to extend their unbeaten run.
For Guinea, complacency is not an option heading into Tuesday's crucial battle for qualification.
Guinea's 1-0 victory over Gambia has put Kaba Diawara's side in the driving seat.
With four points from two games, Guinea control their own destiny going into the final group match.
A single point will be enough for Guinea to seal a top-two spot and book their place in the knockout stages.
Defeat would leave Guinea reliant on Cameroon dropping points against Gambia or a superior goal difference should both teams finish on four points.
Guinea and Senegal shared the same group at the previous AFCON, playing out a goalless draw.
Guinea will undoubtedly hope to replicate that result against the reigning champions on Tuesday.
